intro: Lastrea irenae, commonly known as the Irena's lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, storing water to survive dry periods. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in spring.
